decks.notes: The main concept of this Aggro - Humans deck is to build a strong board presence quickly by utilizing low-cost, efficient creatures like Champion of the Parish, Mantis Rider, and Thalia's Lieutenant. The inclusion of disruption cards like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter helps to control the opponent's plays while maintaining pressure. The deck also benefits from mana efficiency with cards like Noble Hierarch and Aether Vial. This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy, using the synergy between Human creatures and tribal support cards to gain an advantage.

The primary focus of this deck is to aggressively deal direct damage to the opponent using burn spells and efficient creatures. It aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly by efficiently utilizing cards like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Boros Charm to reduce the opponent's life total to zero as fast as possible. The deck also includes powerful threats like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Monastery Swiftspear to pressure the opponent and maintain a fast tempo. The overall strategy is to maintain aggressive pressure and finish the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The focus of this Jeskai Control deck is to establish control over the game through a combination of card advantage, removal, and countermagic. The deck features powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, along with versatile spells like Cryptic Command and Terminus to control the board. With a combination of efficient removal like Lightning Bolt and Path to Exile, alongside card selection tools like Opt and Search for Azcanta, the deck aims to outvalue opponents and secure victory through incremental advantage. Additionally, the manabase is carefully constructed to support the powerful spells in the deck.

This deck aims to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate lots of mana quickly. It uses cards like Sylvan Scrying, Expedition Map, and Ancient Stirrings to find the Tron lands and key threats like Karn Liberated and Wurmcoil Engine. The deck also includes powerful control elements like Oblivion Stone and Walking Ballista to control the board, and finishers like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger to close out the game. The key strategy is to ramp up quickly and overwhelm the opponent with high-impact threats.

The main strategy of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana with creatures like Llanowar Elves and Heritage Druid, then use Chord of Calling or Collected Company to bring out key combo pieces like Devoted Druid and Vizier of Remedies to generate infinite mana. This allows for repetitive activations of Ezuri, Renegade Leader's overrun ability to overwhelm the opponent with pumped up Elf creatures. The deck also includes tools like Eldritch Evolution and Walking Ballista for additional combo potential and removal options. The goal is to create a powerful board state and win the game in a swift and explosive fashion.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay by quickly getting out powerful creatures like Hollow One and Bloodghast. Using cards like Burning Inquiry and Goblin Lore to quickly fill the graveyard and trigger abilities of cards like Flameblade Adept and Flamewake Phoenix. Additionally, using Faithless Looting to dig through the deck and find key cards while also fueling the graveyard. The deck also includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Collective Brutality to control the board while maintaining pressure. Overall, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient threats.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to dominate the game. The deck also includes versatile spells like Cryptic Command and Snapcaster Mage to provide flexibility and efficiency in dealing with threats. By managing the opponent's threats and resources while gaining card advantage, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and secure victory through card advantage and powerful late-game threats.

This Mardu Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creature spells like Young Pyromancer and Bedlam Reveler, using cheap removal like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push to control the board. It also disrupts opponents' hands with cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, while also utilizing powerful spell recursion with Kolaghan's Command and Faithless Looting. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents while also disrupting their game plan, utilizing a mixture of creatures, removal, and hand disruption to stay ahead in the game.

The main focus of this UW Control deck is to manipulate the board state and control the game through a combination of powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, along with efficient removal spells like Terminus, Path to Exile, and Cryptic Command. The deck also includes card advantage through cards like Snapcaster Mage and Ancestral Vision, as well as disruption with counterspells like Spell Snare and Negate. The deck aims to control the game tempo and grind out wins through attrition and powerful late-game threats.

The main idea of this UW Control deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells, removing their threats, and generating card advantage through card draw and selection. With a focus on tempo and board control, the deck utilizes counterspells like Remand and Spell Snare, removal spells like Path to Exile and Terminus, and powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. The deck also includes utility lands like Celestial Colonnade and Field of Ruin to further disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this aggro red deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent's life total using efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike, while also utilizing aggressive creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear. The deck aims to control the board and tempo with cards like Searing Blaze and Eidolon of the Great Revel, maximizing damage output each turn. The deck's mana base is streamlined to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors, allowing for aggressive plays and punishing the opponent for casting spells.

This deck focuses on utilizing cards like Stinkweed Imp, Golgari Thug, and Life from the Loam to quickly fill the graveyard with a mixture of creatures and spells. This allows for powerful combos involving cards like Narcomoeba, Bloodghast, and Prized Amalgam to be quickly brought back to the battlefield. Conflagrate can then be used to deal damage and finish off the opponent. The deck is focused on using the graveyard as a resource to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient combo strategy.

The main focus of this Golgari Aggro deck is to disrupt the opponent's hand with discard spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, while putting pressure on the board with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Tireless Tracker. Removal spells like Fatal Push and Assassin's Trophy help to clear the way for your creatures to attack, while cards like Liliana of the Veil and Liliana, the Last Hope provide additional value and disruption. The deck aims to control the game early on and finish off the opponent quickly before they can stabilize.

The main concept of this Aggro - Humans deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using powerful Human creatures. The deck includes cards like Champion of the Parish, Thalia's Lieutenant, and Mantis Rider to quickly build a strong board presence. Cards like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter disrupt the opponent's game plan, while cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Thalia, Heretic Cathar slow down the opponent. The deck also utilizes Aether Vial and Cavern of Souls to make casting its creatures easier and more efficient.

The main idea of this Jeskai Control deck is to control the game through powerful spells and versatile card advantage. By using a combination of removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Path to Exile, along with counterspells like Cryptic Command and Logic Knot, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building up card advantage with cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Search for Azcanta. The deck also includes win conditions like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Celestial Colonnade to close out the game once it has gained control.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to cast Scapeshift and fetch Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle alongside Mountains to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent in one turn. The key strategy is to efficiently search for lands and combo pieces while controlling the board with removal and sweepers until the combo can be assembled and executed for a game-winning finish. This deck is designed to quickly overwhelm opponents with its powerful combo potential and synergy between cards to create a winning board state.
